intro: Psychotria foetidiflora, commonly known as the stinking psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. It is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is particularly noticeable when the flowers are in bloom. Psychotria foetidiflora is often found in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
